Package baselineCustomClasses

Class PlayingCard

  • java.lang.Object
    • baselineCustomClasses.PlayingCard
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Card31
    public class PlayingCard
extends java.lang.Object
    A playing card class. This class can be used for any game, any program that needs cards. There are a lot of tools in the program to assist playing a variety of different games.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dong-Yon Kim

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description

      A constant that signifies the value of aces must be updated.

      The 4 face card characters.
      static PlayingCard NOT_CARD
      This is a tester PlayingCard that has no current uses.

      The 4 suits.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PlayingCard()  
      PlayingCard​(char f, java.lang.String s)
      Creates a PlayingCard with the given face (K, Q, J, or A) and suit (for face cards and aces).
      PlayingCard​(int n, java.lang.String s)
      Creates a PlayingCard with the given number and suit (for non-face cards and aces).
      PlayingCard​(PlayingCard pc)
      Creates a deep copy of the given PlayingCard object.

    • Method Detail

      • getValueConditions

        public static boolean getValueConditions​(int choice)
                                  throws PlayingCardException
        Gets the status for aces and jacks.
        Parameters:
        choice - - 1 for determining whether aces are high (true) or not (false), 0 for determing whether face cards increment (true) or not (false)
        Returns:
        the selected choice condition - 1: whether aces are high or not, and 0: whether face cards increment or not
        Throws:
        PlayingCardException - - if choice is not 1 or 0 (not asking for face card increment or aces high)

        Used to get the number of the card.
        Returns:
        the number value of the card

      • setValueConditions

        public static void setValueConditions​(int choice,
                                      boolean condition,
                                      int val)
                               throws PlayingCardException
        Sets the values for aces and jacks.
        Parameters:
        choice - - +1 for aces, 0 for face cards
        condition - - true for aces: if aces are high or not (true means aces high), true for faces: whether the face cards increment (11-12-13) or stay the same (10-10-10) (true means faces increment)
        val - - the new value of the card type you chose
        Throws:
        PlayingCardException - - if condition is not 1 or 0 (not a valid option)

      • updateNumber

        public void updateNumber()
                  throws PlayingCardException
        Adjusts the number of the card if at least one of the jack or ace value or the face card increment is changed.
        Throws:
        PlayingCardException - if the face of the card is invalid

      • recieveImage

        public java.awt.Image recieveImage()
        Returns a copy (not the same reference) of the card image with this card's number, face, and suit.
        Returns:
        a deep copy of the image

      • compareByNumber

        public int compareByNumber​(PlayingCard c)
        Compares two cards and returns an int that represents the card that has the larger value.
        Parameters:
        c - - the second PlayingCard you want to compare this PlayingCard against
        Returns:
        -1 when the first card is larger,
        1 when the second card is larger, and
        0 when the two cards are equal.
        This only compares on the basis of number.

      • compareByFace

        public boolean compareByFace​(PlayingCard c)
        Compares two cards and returns a boolean checking if the card's faces are the same.s
        Parameters:
        c - - the second PlayingCard you want to compare this PlayingCard against
        Returns:
        true when the two cards have the same face and
        false when the two cards have different face.
        This only checks if the two cards have the same face, nothing else.

      • compareBySuit

        public boolean compareBySuit​(PlayingCard c)
        Compares two cards and returns a boolean checking if the card's suits are the same.
        Parameters:
        c - - the second PlayingCard you want to compare this PlayingCard against
        Returns:
        true when the two cards have the same suit and
        false when the two cards have different suit.
        This only checks if the two cards have the same suit, nothing else.

      • largestFace

        public static char largestFace()
        Checks whether aces or kings hold more value.
        Returns:
        A if aces are worth more than kings, K otherwise

      • buildAllCards

        public static final PlayingCard[] buildAllCards()
        Creates an array of the standard 52 playing cards.
        Returns:

      • buildHalfDeckCards

        public static final PlayingCard[] buildHalfDeckCards()
        Creates a deck of cards, but starting with the sevens and onwards (excluding 2-6).
        Returns:
        an array of size 32 with all of the standard cards from a pack of 32

      • displayException

        protected static void displayException​(java.lang.Exception e)
        Displays an exception and what you normally would see in the console as a result of said exception in dialog boxes.
        Parameters:
        e - - the Exception you want to display
        location - - where the Exception occured (which class?)
        0: UserInterface
        1: UserPanel
        2: CustomFrame
        3: Player
        4: PlayingCard, and
        5: Other.

      • displayOptions

        protected static int displayOptions​(java.lang.Object body,
                                    java.lang.Object[] selection,
                                    java.lang.String title)
        Displays the Object in a pop up dialog and asks for specific information, based on the selection array.
        Parameters:
        body - - the Object the user wants to display as a JOptionPane
        selection - - the option choices for the buttons of the JOptionPane
        title - - the title of the message
        Returns:
        an integer representing the chosen option from the array

      • displayOptions

        protected static int displayOptions​(java.lang.Object body,
                                    java.lang.String title)
        Displays the Object in a pop up dialog and asks for specific information.
        Parameters:
        body - - the Object the user wants to display as a JOptionPane
        title - - the title of the message
        Returns:
        an integer representing the chosen button (2 for cancel, 0 for yes, 1 for no)

      • displayYesNo

        protected static int displayYesNo​(java.lang.Object body,
                                  java.lang.String title)
        See Also:
        Note that the conditions and return values are exactly the same as: AI31.UserInterface#displayOptions(Object, String). The only difference: This function's buttons are titled YES, NO, and CANCEL, not OK and CANCEL.
